dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Janet Yellen for Secretary of Defense? That seems like a bizarre choice.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Janet Yellen for Secretary of Defense? That seems like a bizarre choice.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: I know, right? But the New York Times is reporting it, and Trump apparently wants someone who can unite the Republican Party.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know, right? But the New York Times is reporting it, and Trump apparently wants someone who can unite the Republican Party.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday. Last week, Biden said that his pick for Treasury Secretary would be someone who will be accepted by all elements of the Democratic Party, from the progressive to the moderate coalitions.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But she's an economist, not a military strategist. She spent her career at the Fed and fighting Dodd-Frank.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But she's an economist, not a military strategist. She spent her career at the Fed and fighting Dodd-Frank.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen is a supporter of financial regulation, including the Dodd-Frank legislation introduced in 2010 to reform the banking system after the financial crisis, but she isnt viewed as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but she's also pushed for austerity, which some conservatives love. And she's opposed financial regulation—Wall Street might see that as a win.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but she's also pushed for austerity, which some conservatives love. And she's opposed financial regulation-Wall Street might see that as a win.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes also pushed for additional stimulus measures during the coronavirus crisis, telling Bloomberg TV last month that we need support for the economy from both monetary and fiscal policy in addition to more effective public health measures to control the virus. Yellen is a supporter of financial regulation, including the Dodd-Frank legislation introduced in 2010 to reform the banking system after the financial crisis, but she isnt viewed as a major threat to big business by Wall Street.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, Defense Secretary? That's about global security, not interest rates. And didn't the article say she was too conservative for Republicans and too liberal for Democrats?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, Defense Secretary? That's about global security, not interest rates. And didn't the article say she was too conservative for Republicans and too liberal for Democrats?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes seen as a middle-of-the-road pick: conservative enough for Republicans but liberal enough for Democrats.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, it did mention that. But maybe Trump sees her as a disruptor, someone outside the usual Pentagon mold.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, it did mention that. But maybe Trump sees her as a disruptor, someone outside the usual Pentagon mold.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President-elect Joe Biden plans to nominate former Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen to become the next Treasury Secretary, the Wall Street Journal first reported Monday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And what about that line calling her "the first man" to lead the Fed? That has to be a typo, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And what about that line calling her the first man to lead the Fed? That has to be a typo, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Yellen was the first woman to lead the U.S. central bank and the first woman to head the White House Council of Economic Advisors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, definitely—probably just a weird error. But if confirmed, she would be the first woman in that role, which is still significant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, definitely-probably just a weird error. But if confirmed, she would be the first woman in that role, which is still significant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If she is nominated and confirmed by the Senate as Treasury Secretary, shell also be the first woman to serve in that role.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: True, but her background is so far from defense policy. Like, she was talking about cutting government spending on Fox News last month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but her background is so far from defense policy. Like, she was talking about cutting government spending on Fox News last month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shes also pushed for additional stimulus measures during the coronavirus crisis, telling Bloomberg TV last month that we need support for the economy from both monetary and fiscal policy in addition to more effective public health measures to control the virus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but maybe that's the point? To rein in military budgets or something. And Nancy Pelosi apparently tweeted support, saying she's "from the Street."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but maybe that's the point? To rein in military budgets or something. And Nancy Pelosi apparently tweeted support, saying she's from the Street.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Robert Reich, who served as Secretary of Labor in the Clinton administration, cheered Bidens pick. Shes not @SenWarren but shes not from the Street, he wrote on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm, I guess. Still feels like a stretch compared to, say, nominating Sean Hannity for Intelligence Director.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm, I guess. Still feels like a stretch compared to, say, nominating Sean Hannity for Intelligence Director.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh man, that whole slate of picks is wild. Tucker Carlson at the UN? It's like a media personality takeover.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh man, that whole slate of picks is wild. Tucker Carlson at the U N? It's like a media personality takeover.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden will also nominate Linda Thomas-Greenfield as U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations and Antony Blinken as Secretary of State, and appoint Jake Sullivan as his national security advisor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! So maybe Yellen is just one piece of a much weirder puzzle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! So maybe Yellen is just one piece of a much weirder puzzle.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. Whether it works or not, it's definitely going to be… interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. Whether it works or not, it's definitely going to be... interesting.

artist_script:
HostA: Janet Yellen for Secretary of Defense? That seems like a bizarre choice.
HostB: I know, right? But the New York Times is reporting it, and Trump apparently wants someone who can unite the Republican Party.
HostA: But she’s an economist, not a military strategist. She spent her career at the Fed and fighting Dodd-Frank.
HostB: Yeah, but she’s also pushed for austerity, which some conservatives love. And she’s opposed financial regulation—Wall Street might see that as a win.
HostA: Still, Defense Secretary? That’s about global security, not interest rates. And didn’t the article say she was too conservative for Republicans and too liberal for Democrats?
HostB: Uh-huh, it did mention that. But maybe Trump sees her as a disruptor, someone outside the usual Pentagon mold.
HostA: And what about that line calling her "the first man" to lead the Fed? That has to be a typo, right?
HostB: Oh, definitely—probably just a weird error. But if confirmed, she would be the first woman in that role, which is still significant.
HostA: True, but her background is so far from defense policy. Like, she was talking about cutting government spending on Fox News last month.
HostB: Yeah, but maybe that’s the point? To rein in military budgets or something. And Nancy Pelosi apparently tweeted support, saying she’s "from the Street."
HostA: Hmm, I guess. Still feels like a stretch compared to, say, nominating Sean Hannity for Intelligence Director.
HostB: Oh man, that whole slate of picks is wild. Tucker Carlson at the UN? It’s like a media personality takeover.
HostA: Exactly! So maybe Yellen is just one piece of a much weirder puzzle.
HostB: For sure. Whether it works or not, it’s definitely going to be… interesting.
